spanGrp.span: NHK talks about the agricultural cycle, how the Tabaq people prepare the fields, what they do when the first rains come and how the work is divided.
video not focused, audio-recording with some background noise, but generally good
Panasonic Lumix DMC-GH2K (set to AVCHD(1080i), FSH), plus external stereo microphone (Rode Stereo VideoMic) & windshield
Zoom H4n, internal microphone (set to WAV, 44.1Hz/16bit) & windshield
D13NHKFarmingcycle.mts (= original video) D13NHKFarmingcycle_Zoom.wav (= separate audio recording, time code doesn't match time code of video) D13NHKFarmingcycle.txt (= this Toolbox file)
the speech I am going to tell
that work all and the work the Tabaq
ʊʊnd̪ʊka nɑd̪ʊfɛtʊ ʃaarɪʲɛɛ naz ah ka ʃɔɔrɛʈɛɛ
on things you clean the ground with like ah the instruments you cut grass with and
nad̪ɑɑfa (Ar.) "cleaning"; naas (Ar.) "people" hereː "like"; ka refers to the instrument you use; [ʃarɪʲɛː]
ʈiika wɪɪka ɖuwuʈu ʃaarɪ ʈii kuʈɛɛ
that one for sorghum, threshing things, all this
it is me you (pl) speak for I want (i.e. I want to tell to you (pl))
̠applicative ndi; e.g.ː aʲɪŋkɛnditɛ 'I am telling this for you vs. aʲɪŋkɛʈɛ 'I am telling you'
ah, awal ħaaja wɪɪ.. jaani kʊ.. kʊŋɪr; gajɛʃɪ
ah, first thing sorghum.. i.e. fa.. to the farms they go and
kʊŋɪ nɑdʊfɛɛka; kʊt̪ʊ ʷɔkʊnd̪ʊŋga ɖɛŋgɛɽɛ ɖiilɛn
the fields they clean if the field is old; they gather straw
t̪ʊʊʷa ajji ʃaa ʃaak.. ʊ.. dɪnakʊɲa kʊt̪ʊr fɪʈʊ ʃaa kuʈɛɛ diilɛn, ʷɔː
in the place (i.e. farm) every thing thing.. ah.. starts (i.e. grows) in the field that is thing all they gather, burn
also if it is for a new field
the new field if they clear (cut the trees) a new field
ɛɛ kʊt̪ʊ kuʈɛɛ nɑdʊfɛnaj, ɛɛ arɛʷa iɲiin
and after they had cleaned all the farm, then surely they wait for the rain
xalas, arɛ awal narɛr irɪ ʈɪrɪɪm
enough, rain, in the first rain the people cultivate
after the rain twice or three times after it has rained
unyi.. our ground.. water.. is satisfied with water
ndɪɪ.. ʈi ʈɪŋgaʈʊ ʃaa, ɛlɛmdʊr ɖɪnakʊʈʊ wa
(no meaning) they planted (some)thing, quickly they want it to grow (lit. 'stand up; start')
ah ʈii t̪ʊʊ kawʊʈʊ nɔgi.. maʔnaata
and that place (dry) sowed (when) that means
a dry sowed field means that you finished sowing anything before the rain comes; ʊ [ʊʊ]; ʈɪnaŋgaʈʊ [ʈɪnaŋgaɽʊ]
ɛɛ ʊʊnd̪ʊr ɖiʈʊka arɛʲa t̪andən.. t̪aʈʊŋga t̪walɪ dɪnakʊʊn
and in the ground is lying and the rain if it comes immediately it grows
dry sowing (there) is; also wet sowing (there) is
ʈii kawɛndi, jaani id̪ʊ, t̪ʊʊ kawʊŋgana fɪʈʊŋga
it is that dry sowing, i.e. the person, place if he sowed when dry, if he is said (if you heared)
jaani, wɪɪndʊŋgaa kaa t.., ʃaa.. ʈɪŋgaʈʊ ʃaa
i.e., if it is sorghum or t.., thing.. a planted thing
in the ground after they cover it / put it inside, it is the reain they wait for
ʈii k.. ʊʊt̪ɪ.. ʊ t̪ʊʊ kawʊʈʊr, kamaan fɪɪ nʒaarɪ
when you sowed the farm, also the bush things (i.e. all animals, even birds and insects)
like birds (sp. with red legs) then all pigeons
ʈii ʊʊŋgʊt̪ʊ ʊ kʊldiʲɛn, ɪlla ʃinu t.. kʊt̪ʊ kʊɲʊʷa
that your farm for you they eat, unless farm protect
kʊldiʲɛn [kʊɽiʲa]; kʊɲʊʷa not in Dict.db; illa shinu (Ar.) "only, unless"
arɛ, t̪aʈʊ nɔgɪd̪ʊraar, ʊ ʈi.. ʈɪrɪɪɲaʈʊŋga, bɔrd̪ʊ
rain, comes at the time when, in case you sowed, also (i.e. also, when the rain comes in case you sowed)
jaanɪː, t̪ʊʊ nʒaarɪ na.. ħaʃaraat ɛnɛ ɖɔrɛ
meaning, insects (lit. 'things of the place') insects these small (ones)
ʃar.. ʃaarɪ ʊ kamɛndiʲa, laazim ʃinu
things they eat for you, must because
i.e., poison if there is bring it
ʷu.. ɪ.. ʊ.. ʊ wɪɪka ʃawʊn
I.. i.. you.. you mix it with sorghum
'ʃawɛ' with this meaning not in Dict.db
ɪja bɛlɛka na ʃawʊn, ʊʷa ʈɪnand̪ʊ
either with simsim or mix it, after you finish sowing
'ɪja' relates to the 'sorghum' from the entry before; not in Dict.db yet; in D13NHKfarmingcycle_0075 with the meaning of 'also' attested
aʃaan ʃinu, ʃaarɪ ʊ kʊt̪ʊ kʊlɪmɪʲɛ
why? because, things (here 'insects') your farm do not eat
check transcription last word; notes said 'kʊlɪmnɛ'; 'ashaan shinu (Ar.) "because, why?"
xalas, i ʈɪrɛʈʊː, kʊt̪ʊ fud̪umbu.. fud̪u.. fud̪uma..
finally, what we sow, farm/field after it grew
NHK claims that he wanted to say 'fud̪umbʊrʊ'; khalaaṣ (Ar.) "enough, finally"
then it is the cleaning (that) starts the cleaning
ʃɔɔrɛː dɪnakʊʊn awwal haja k.. ʈii bʊnd̪ʊ
it is the cleaning that starts first that grass
murra ʈii bʊbʊbʊbʊ.. bʊnd̪ʊ, awal na ʷɔɔr ʃɔɔnaaʲ
first weeds that (...) grass first of it first after cleaning (i.e. after cleaning the first weeds)
sorghum a bit after it grew (lit. 'climbed')
baa 'a bit' not yet in Dict.db; [d̪ɛŋɪɲɪmbarʊ]
they do the second cleaning and hole one, hole one (i.e. in each hole)
wɪɪ ʊrʊ ʊrʊ ɛnɛ ʈʊɟʊ ʈʊɟʊ ɛnɛ fɛʈʊŋga
sorghum two in each or three in each they are (put) inside
jaan wɪɪ zijaada, dɛkɪɲɛʈʊŋga, ʊʷa ʈii, bɛkɪ
i.e. sorghum more, has grown, you some of them
jaan = jaani =ya'nɪ (Ar.) "meaning, i.e., let us say"; ziyaada (Ar.) "extra, more"
ah, ʈikaa kʊʃkʊʃwɛʲan wɔʃɛɛn, ʈikaa aljɪn t̪ʊʊː faad̪i fitʊŋgala kaʃɪ ʈi wɪɪ ʊʊ, aljɪŋgaʈʊ, kaʃɪ t̪ʊʊ faad̪irʊka ʈir, ʊŋgʊt̪a kɛɛŋaʲan
ah, (it is named) singling out we call it pick them out place empty if there is take those sorghum (plants) you picked out, take it to the empty place when you sowed your farm surely will become good
xalas, ɛɛ, arɛ xalas kwɔdɛmbʊrʊ ʈii ʃ.. awal nʒɔɔrɛ, tumunaaʲ
enough, then rain enough after it has rained that first cleaning after it is finished
kwɔdɛmbʊrʊ ?; tumun- only in DictInfo.db with wrong idx, not in Dict.db (t̪?); khalaaṣ (Ar.) "enough"; awwal (Ar.) "first"
ʃaald̪ʊ kuʈɛfɪ, ʃaald̪ʊ dɪʲɛ.. kʷɔt̪ɛɛ ʃaalid̪ɛɛ, ʈaand̪ɔɔɲɪʲɛɛ, t̪aanɪɪd̪ɛ kuʈɛfɪnɛ dɪɪr gajɛn
the whole family, the family (no meaning) the man the wife, his/her children, the Tabaq, all of them surely go to work
food from the houses they prepared, they will come
ʃɛ.. kʊt̪ʊr ʃɛʲa, ɪja kamaan, kʊt̪ʊra kamɛʲa aŋaa
(no meaning) to the farm they surely go, also also, in the farm surely food will be made
later now surely they do the second cleaning
iinajɛn not in Dict.db (see also next entry, 0079); ɛɛla [ala]
some/other farms twice even are cleaned (i.e. all in all three times)
ah t̪ʊʊ jaani bʊnd̪ɔ ʷɔʈʊ fuduʃɪ.. fud̪u fud̪uʃɪ t̪ʊʊnʊŋga
(a) place it means tall grass growing grows growing high growing if it is a place
then after finishing the second cleaning of the field
then finally in that time of the second cleaning
like that they do not eat
things meaning from the past people
after tasting the old people gather (sth.)
ʃaarɪ ʊʊld̪ɛnand̪ʊ, hata.. kalaŋt̪ʊ t̪ɔɔɲɪ twɪɪ.. ɖɔrɛʲa kamʊ
things start tasting them, (no meaning) later the small children eat
naas a.. wɔkɪʲɛɛ ʈii aal.. ɛ.. ʷɔɔr fɪɪɲaʈʊ ʃaarɪ, ʈii ʊʊld̪ʊ ʊʊld̪ʊnaaj
like beans and those things that come out (escape) first, those after they taste and taste
naas (Ar.) "people; like"; ʈi ʊʊld̪ʊ ʊʊld̪ʊnaaj [ti ʊʊld̪ʊd̪ʊnaj]; ʃaarɪ [ʃarɪ]
meaning in the beginning a.. first
ijɛn adiil id̪ʊ, ʃaa wuun kʊlʊm
it is forbidden immediately person something like that to eat (lit. he eats)
ijɛn *[ijɛma] not in Dict.db; 'adiil (Ar.) "immediately, straight forward"
tʊwɛɛi.. t̪ɔɔɲɪ ɖʷɛɛnɪ ɛnɛ, ʃaarɪ bʊkʊn kamʊʈʊŋga
small boys even things steal if they eat them
irɪ ʷɔʈɛʲa ʈii fɪltɛka, ʈii kʊʊn
old people blame them and stop them
fɪltɛka not in Dict.db, related to fɪ 'say'? kʊʊn not in Dict.db, related to kʊʊ 'carry'?
kamaan, kad̪aad̪aa fi, kad̪aad̪a ɛɛla ʷɔn
also, there is hibiscus, hibiscus also they cook
ɛɛ, fʊtʊfʊtʊɲɪ ŋgamɛɛr t̪akɛɛn fʊtʊfutʊɲɪɪ, kamaan ʈii ʃaald̪ʊ ŋgariibʊr ʃɛʈundɛ fʊtʊfʊtʊɲɪʲa ʊʊl kʊʊn
then eating of (= from) the housefarms they enter housefarms, also those houses near are (i.e. those that are near the houses) housefarms name have (i.e. are named housefarms)
fʊtʊfʊtʊɲɪ 'housefarm' not in Dict.db; gariib (Ar.) "near"; ʊʊl kʊʊn [ʊʊkʊʊn]
jaanɪ ʊʊnʒaal nuut̪ʊ xalas fʊtʊfʊtʊʷa [fʊtʊtaa] ʃʷa
i.e. your house close from (i.e. to) the housefarm is
ʈikaa ʷɔɔr kaː irɪ kamɛ t̪akɛɛn
that first with people eating enter (i.e. the things from the housefarm are eaten first from the new harvest)
in the bush farms, peo�ple eating enter
i.e.ː only later people start eating the new harvest from the bush farm
now, enough, then things after they have ripened
[+] kʊt̪ʊr ʃuuna fɪʈʊ, tu kʷii kʊt̪ʊr ʃuumbʊrʊ
to the farm surely goes" they call it, after that kujuur went to the farm
? later ah ah, the people surely
after he went to the farm
ɛɛ taani ni ikʊnd̪ʊ bɛkɪʲa bɪʲanɪʲɛɛ, naas ɛnɛ kɔmbalɪʲɛɛ
then next clans other surely like the Biani and people those Kombali
the kujuur?clan and the shumtuni they surely
ah kʊt̪ʊ mbaʃɛndɛʲa awal ħaaja kʊt̪ʊ ba.. ʷɔɔr baʃɛmʊnd̪ʊ, kʊt̪ʊ tuʃu
ah the harvest of the farm is first the farm first before harvesting the farm break (i.e. breaking the sorghum)
tuʃu not in Dict.db, cf. also D13NHKfarmingcycle_0129; awwal ħaaja (Ar.) "first thing"
it means that the sorfhum because it is tall
aʃaan ʃunu, wɪɪd̪ʊ gariibɛmbʊrʊ ɛɛ baʃɛʲa kalaŋt̪ʊ ala t̪aran
why because, the sorghum after it comes nearer then the cutting later then will come
after you have first broken the farm
they bring in one place this sorghum
the men sorghum harvest and the women carry it
they carry this sorghum all of it they carry (it to)
t̪ʊʊ bɛɛ nad̪ʊfɛn t̪ʊʊ faʲɛka kaː
place other they clean a place wide and
nad̪aafa (Ar.) "cleaning"; faʲɛka 'wide' add to faʲɛ 'outside' in Dict.db
dʊt̪ʊ 'flat stone'ː with this meaning not in Dict.db; 'flat stone wrong?
if it is earth if they cleaned
kʊʊnd̪ɛ iʃɛŋgarɛŋga ɛɛ xalas wɪɪ kuʈɛɛ ɖiilɛnaaʲ ala kalaŋt̪ʊna ʃinu, wɪɪ ɖuwa
and fence shrubs that they have made and finally after having collect all the sorghum and later because, they thresh the sorghum
kʊʊnd̪ɛ iʃɛŋgarɛŋga betterː kʊʊnd̪ɛ kʊŋgarɛŋga (however, both unknown) khalaaṣ (Ar.) "enough"; ʃinu (Ar.) "why"; 'ala (Ar.) "in addition"
fine, the things with which we harvest thing
cutting blade surely it is called
nʊʊl kʊʊn [nʊʊkʊʊn]; aakara Ar. ? not in Dict.db
with the cutting blade with they harvest
ʈii aakara kwalɛmʊnd̪ʊŋgala, kwalɛmɪ id̪a, kʊfa
if one does not have a cutting blade, a person does not have it, a knife
with his knife then, the sorghum he will cut
lakin kʊfan.. wɪɪ ŋgɪʃɛ, tagiil, ʈiɽu
but with a knife cutting of sorghum is difficult /heavy
ʈiɽu "difficult" add meaning to Dict.db laakin (Ar.) "but"; tagiil (Ar.) "heavy"
aʃaan kɪda ʈii kwɔkara bamand̪ʊnd̪ʊ iʃɪr ʊ tʊtʊ iʃɪr i kʊmɛŋga
for the reason that the cutting blade is very small you put it in a hand in the hand we hide it

whole section needs to be checked with regard to transcription and meaning 'ashaan kida (Ar.) "for the reason" kwɔkara = aakara; according to N.H.K., the first word is better; not in Dict.db; bamand̪ʊnd̪ʊ ?; tʊtʊ ?; kʊmɛŋga ?
ɛɛ wɪɪ sariiʲa; ɛlɛmdʊ ɛlɛmdʊ wɪɪ kɪ
then the sorghum quick quickly quickly sorghum it cuts
kɪ- 'cut' change root in Dict.db sarii' (Ar.)"quick"
kamaan bɛlɛɛʷa ɛɛla kamaan kɪndi, bɛlɛɛʷa ɛɛla tɪdɪndit.. ʈɪɪ ʊŋgʊʊndiʈʊ
also it is simsim also also they cut simsim it is also (no meaning) table they catch (i.e. prepare)
ʈɪɪ 'sesame table' not in Dict.db kamaan (Ar.)
jaan ʈii ʈɪɪ, bɛlɛɛnaaʲ kamaan du.. zɛj d̪uunaka ditu
i.e. that table for simsim also like a shelter ?
a short shelter that simsim bring
kuʈɛɛ ʊkʊɲɛʈʊ, ʃʷaɲɪkʊmbʊrʊ kalaŋt̪ʊna bɛlɛɛ tuu

all of it you put (repeatedly) after it is dry later the simsim you separate (i.e. they take a bundle from the shelter, hold it upside down and shake it gently so that the seeds fall into a container or a cloth)
the simsim they separate (for) and finally they collect it (repeatedly)
the granaries that are for sorghum are big granaries
ɛɛ bɛlɛɛ naandiʲa d̪ʊ́lʊ́ɲɪ́ ɖɔrɛ bɛlɛɛʲɛɛ naas tɔ́nɛ̀kɪ̀ʲɛɛ ʈii kuʈɛfɪ ʈiindɛ.. ʈiindɪɪ
and for simsim are small granaries it is simsim and groundnuts all this (...) their work (= function)
they k.. bring all those things
some/other sorghum is bundled, and hung up in trees
so that insects don't reach them
ɛɛ ʊmuɲ nʊʊla ala aljɛn ʈɪɪ
then it is surely the beginning of the short rainy season now they take them down and sow them
sorghum and maize all is bundled and
the Tabaq by working together work they do since the past
check wʊʊn nafiir (Ar.) "collective work, voluntary working party"
irɪ fɪfʊʊn masalaan ʊ dɪɪ at̪amʊr kwaɽ.. awiil kwaɽʊŋga, irɪ fɪfʊʊtʊ
people invite (often) e.g. you work tomorrow have, after tomorrow if you have people you call
ʊʊnʒɪɪraanɛ ħata ħila.. ħilɛ bɛʈʊ nɛnɛ
your neighbours even village another even
and they tii.. on the day of your work
all of them (no meaning) gather in the field
and the field you they assist (i.e. and they help you in the field)
ɛɛ kamaan na.. ʈiʲa ɛɛla ɖɪɪ kwalʊŋga, ʊʊ fɪtʊ ʊʷa ala, ʈiinɖɪɪr ʃuʷa
then also (no meaning) it's them then work if they have, and call you it is you then to their work you will go
a person does not work (on) his farm alone
or if it is sowing if it is harvesting all is collective work
ka 'or' not in Dict.db (meaning not entirely clear) kullo nafiir (Ar.) "all collective work"
(..) by collective work the Tabaq people work
ah xalas ɛɛ wɪɪ kuʈɛɛ ɖiilɛnaaʲ
and finally then all the sorghum after collecting
if there is cotton and it is cotton
ah cotton they gather in bags they press it
and to the market it is they take it
ɛɛ ɛnɛ ʃaarɪ bɛkɪʷa akɛŋga id̪ʊ, sɔrum kɔnd̪ʊ id̪ʊ
and it is those other things a person kept, a man with a need
he takes a thing and trades it
t̪ɪɪ kwalɛʈʊŋga mala.. t̪ɪɪ ʃʊnaaʲ ʈi wɪɪʲa tʷaaŋgaɽʊ ʊnd̪ɔɔɲɪ kama
if he has cows he will trade a cow that sorghum reserved your children will eat
aaj, iŋ ɛɛː iŋ.. t̪aanɪɪ kambɛt̪ʊnɛ ʊt̪ʊnɛ ʃɔɔrɛm
yes, thus the Tabaq people cultivated since the past
